channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Storm Floodwaters in Indonesia Turned Logs Into Floating Projectiles
item.description: Many logs became forces of destruction in Indonesia last week, in a sign that deforestation compounded the devastation wrought by a cyclone.

item.title: Binance names cofounder Yi He as new co-CEO
item.description: Yi He has worked in crypto since the early days of the industry, and becomes one of only a handful of women to lead a crypto firm.

item.title: Michael Dell, who’s donating $6.25 billion to ‘Trump Accounts’ for kids, says a childhood savings account changed his life
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Visiting Turkey and Lebanon, Pope Leo Echoed Francis’s Message, Not His Style
item.description: Traveling through the Mideast, Leo XIV channeled many of his predecessor’s messages. Leo’s deliberate manner differed from Francis.

item.title: Trump’s pick for chairman isn’t enough to threaten Fed independence, says Bank of America—especially if Jerome Powell decides to stick around
item.description: "The question then becomes, will Powell leave as a governor?"

item.title: Inside Venezuela
item.description: We explain how President Nicolás Maduro is responding to threats from the Trump administration.

item.title: Video games can teach designers deeper lessons than ‘high score streaks’ and gamification
item.description: Game design holds important lessons for education, said Lee Schuneman, the chief product officer at edtech firm Efekta Education Group.

item.title: Trump’s Xenophobic Outburst, and a Planned Donation to 25 Million U.S. Kids
item.description: Plus, the 10 best books of the year.

item.title: A Chinese ice cream chain, powered by super-cheap cones, now has more outlets than McDonald’s
item.description: Chilled drinks and cool prices are helping Mixue take over the booming sweet treat market.

item.title: The Hong Kong Fire: A Crisis in the National Security Era
item.description: The authorities quickly arrested critics demanding accountability, signaling an expansive use of the security law to silence dissent over nonpolitical...

item.title: Fabergé Winter Egg Sells for $30 Million, an Auction Record
item.description: Fabergé is believed to have produced 50 of the ornate eggs for Russia’s czars. The Winter Egg, sold on Tuesday, is considered one of the jewelry house...

item.description: Many logs became forces of destruction in Indonesia last week, in a sign that deforestation compounded the devastation wrought by a cyclone.

item.description: The authorities quickly arrested critics demanding accountability, signaling an expansive use of the security law to silence dissent over nonpolitical...

item.title: Visiting Turkey and Lebanon, Pope Leo Echoed Francis’s Message, Not His Style
item.description: Traveling through the Mideast, Leo XIV channeled many of his predecessor’s messages. Leo’s deliberate manner differed from Francis.

item.title: What Is Pope Leo XIV Like Up Close?
item.description: Pope Leo XIV showed the world a glimpse of who he is and what he stands for during his papacy’s first international overseas trip. Motoko Rich, our Ro...
